messages.content:
You are a helpful Ontology engineer. 
                   Generate a class description including information of axioms and current description. 
                   The description should be concise and informative, providing a clear understanding of the class's purpose and characteristics.
                   Don't generate unnecessary text. Just generate class description only.

Generate a class description including information of axioms and current description. 
                   If there is no description, generate a description based on the axiom.

For example, Class name : giraffe
Class axiom: {
"subClassOf": [
"animal"
],
"disjointWith": [
"lion"
],
"propertyRestrictions": [
"[eats only (Twig or leaf)]"
]}
Current description: "Giraffes are herbivores, and they eat only leaves.",
"they also eat twigs"

Generated description could be:
giraffe is defined as a subclass of animal, and it is explicitly disjoint from lion - meaning no individual can simultaneously be both a lion and a giraffe. 
Members of this class are herbivores, characterized by a strict diet: they eat only leaves or twigs (no other food types are permitted as part of their diet). 
This formalization ensures that any individual classified as a giraffe must have an exclusively leaf- or twig-based diet, consistent with observed giraffe feeding behaviors.
Now, generate the description using class axiom and current description below.
Class name: Accelerometer
Axiom: {'subClassOf': ['WearableSensor']}
Generated description:

For example, Property name : eats
Property axiom: {
      "characteristics": [],
      "domain": [
        "None"
      ],
      "range": [
        "(animal or plant or [is-part-of some animal] or [is-part-of some plant])"
      ],
      "subPropertyOf": [],
      "inverseOf": []
    }

Generated description could be:
The property "eats" has no explicitly defined characteristics, domain restrictions, or super-properties. 
Its range is limited to individuals classified as animals, plants, or entities that are part of an animal or plant. 
This indicates that the property is used to relate entities to animals, plants, or their constituent parts. No inverse property is specified.
